timeline.bodyText:
Instead of passing userId, can we pass User object instead? The reason is so that we don't have to load User again from the id in RoomLocalDataStore
See usages of loadUser in RoomLocalDataStore
timeline.author: shobhitagarwal1612

replies.bodyText: But that would require adding *MutationEntityRelations to fetch User when loading from local db.
replies.author: shobhitagarwal1612

replies.bodyText:
That would push the loading of the User to the time of loading Mutations, which at DB level would mean either loading each User individually, or doing a join to fetch them together. Loading them individually isn't a big deal since they're small, there will be few of them (max 2?) and the db is practically in memory. If we go that route, I think doing a query to fill them in the persistence later is more discoverable than using MutationEntityRelations.
Filed #301 to revisit this.
